hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cluster Contrarian Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences clustered long liquidations (>$150M aggregate within 2 hours) during NEUTRAL regime without fundamental catalyst, price rebounds 2-4% within 6 hours as forced selling exhausts.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidation cascades in neutral markets without fundamental drivers are often technical/mechanical. When spot volume remains moderate, it suggests the selling is primarily leveraged positions being stopped out rather than fundamental selling. This creates temporary oversold conditions.
entry_conditions: BTC long liquidations >$150M across all exchanges in 2-hour window
No major fundamental news (macro data, regulatory announcements, exchange issues)
Price decline during liquidation event is <8% (not a crash)
Spot volume during event is <1.5x 20-day average (not organic selling)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3% price recovery from liquidation low OR 6 hours elapsed
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops another 2% below liquidation low with increasing volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price continues declining with high spot volume (>2x average) after liquidations, indicating fundamental selling pressure rather than just leverage flush.
